getCurrentState

@NotNull
protected State getCurrentState()
Get the current state It returns a reference to the top item on the stack If the stack is empty (start of the document) we create a new State object and set the base and language values so they are inherited throughout the document

Returns:
the current state

push

protected void push(State state)
Add a State object onto the state stack If this is the first object on the stack set the base value from values we've been given by the caller

Parameters:
state - State object to add to stack

startElement

public void startElement(String uri,
                         String localName,
                         String qName,
                         Attributes atts)
                  throws SAXException
Look for a method to deal with the state of the current element. Creates a new state object. Deals with inline xml content If the element method fails to push the state, we do it for them. We default to not expecting content

Specified by:
startElement in interface ContentHandler
Overrides:
startElement in class org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
